newsitem.title: POLAND: Poland to choose bank PBK investor by June 12.
newsitem.headline: Poland to choose bank PBK investor by June 12.

text.p: A government committee negotiating the sale of up to 65 percent of Powszechny Bank Kredytowy SA (PBK) should choose an investor by June 12, a deputy finance minister said on Friday.
"The negotiating committee met yesterday and examined the offers. The decision will come by June 12, possibly earlier," Karol Szwarc told Reuters.
The state treasury is offering up to 65 percent of PBK shares, preferably a majority stake, to a strategic investor or a group of investors.
Earlier the finance ministry's adviser on the sale said a final decision could be expected by the end of this week but Szwarc said the committee was still reviewing the offers.
Neither the ministry nor its adviser HSBC Investment Services would say how many final bids had been placed for PBK.
So far only a consortium of Polish Development Bank (PBR), Bank Przemyslowo-Handlowy (BPH), Kredyt Bank and insurer Warta confirmed it was bidding for at least 51 percent of PBK.
Banking sources have said South Korea's Samsung was also interested in buying stakes in PBK but it did not confirm the reports. -- Warsaw Newsroom +48 22 653 9700
